column4: Hey guys I've downloaded Ubuntu installation disk (10.04) and it will not boot up ( I am getting a blank screen right after I click "try ubuntu.." or if I enable the advance settings (by trial and error: "nomodeset") it will show the loading screen but then will stuck (clicking F1 shows it stops right after "setting sensors limit [ok])) Any Idea how can I solve this ?
did you check the disc for defects?
and burnt to cd using nero or sumthin... and when you check disc it appears to be ok, it returns test with 0 defects?
I have used "Infrarecorder" , I have checked the disc from the boot menu
consider trying to put iso on usb-stick. I can't say why, your cd is not working
you've done md5sum test of iso, burnt it to cd, checked for defects but get blank screen why you click on 'install' what can one say?
try another cd ? alternatively, try usb, I don't know what else to suggest
alright , I will try USB-stick , thank you for your help
http://unetbootin.sourceforge.net/ don't know if you know this site
might not be the best idea. Had any other opinions?
I am still trying to find my USB-stick but I have located only my 512MB and unfortunately it is not enough
its best to use a pendrive. I asked in #linux and #ubuntu-uk and couple people say it might not be a good idea. Maybe don't want to risk it
wouldn't want you to hate ubuntu afterwards :)
: Ok my other option is MicroSD 2GB on a cardreader but I think it will be slow
i'd like to know whether that works out
